item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeHarm Reduction Action CenterThis is our injectable Naloxone drawer. It is looking pretty sad and empty right...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeHarm Reduction Action Center

This is our injectable Naloxone drawer. It is looking pretty sad and empty right now. We are experiencing a shortage in injectable Naloxone in Colorado and nasa...l Narcan is INCREDIBLY expensive at the moment. We're in the worst overdose crisis we have ever seen, and the very last thing we need is a shortage/unavailability of Naloxone. We are spending most of our money on accessing Narcan. Our folks need it. It's lifesaving!
So, what can you do to help? Because most of our money is going towards buying Narcan for our folks, we are quickly running out of money to purchase other necessary items like snacks, water, socks, hygiene, etc. Luckily, we have an Amazon wishlist of all the items we need! You can find our wishlist here: https://a.co/2brD29C
You can also donate directly to HRAC to help us purchase Naloxone TODAY: https://harmreductionactioncenter.wedid.it/
‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èPlease check out our wishlist link or donate directly if you are willing and able to help!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

See More

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeCity and County of Denver GovernmentWant to earn extra income by sharing space in your home? Sunshine Home...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeCity and County of Denver Government

Want to earn extra income by sharing space in your home? Sunshine Home Share Colorado matches someone seeking housing with someone 55 or older. This program hel...ps older adults gain companionship and stay in their homes, while renters can exchange supportive services like lawn mowing and household chores for affordable rent. Email BTW50plus@denvergov.org to join Denver Economic Development & Opportunity for a September 1 webinar.

item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeA year after George Floyd‚Äôs murder and the summer of protests that followed, communities and law enforcement in places like Northeast Park Hill in Denver are wondering what approach is the right one.

cpr.org

As Crime Rises In Denver, One Historically Black Neighborhood Considers What It Wants From Police

A year after George Floyd‚Äôs murder and the summer of protests that followed, communities and law enforcement in places like Northeast Park Hill in Denver are wondering what approach is the right one.A year after George Floyd‚Äôs murder and the summer of protests that followed, communities and law enforcement in places like Northeast Park Hill in Denver are wondering what approach is the right one.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeViolence in Denver so far this year is on track to meet or exceed the bloodshed of 2020, when the city...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeViolence in Denver so far this year is on track to meet or exceed the bloodshed of 2020, when the city recorded the highest number of homicides since 1981.

denverpost.com

For second year in a row, Denver homicides and shootings on pace to meet levels of bloodshed not seen in decades

Violence in Denver so far this year is on track to meet or exceed the bloodshed of 2020, when the city recorded the highest number of homicides since 1981.Violence in Denver so far this year is on track to meet or exceed the bloodshed of 2020, when the city recorded the highest number of homicides since 1981.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeColorado Village CollaborativeThanks so much to everyone who has been supporting Colorado Village...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeColorado Village Collaborative

Thanks so much to everyone who has been supporting Colorado Village Collaborative and partners with the current SOS site moves, and those who supported the buil...d of the original SOS sites.

We move to Regis University in exactly one week, and are asking for your help in the final push over the next few days. Please use the SignUpGenius link below to sign up for volunteering this weekend and for the move on June 1st. https://www.signupgenius.com/go/9040b45a5ae2baa8-safe

Additionally, we still have some openings to provide meals to our residents at Regis University. Please consider signing up to do so here: https://www.mealtrain.com/trains/723092

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeColorado Village CollaborativeSafe Outdoor Spaces are one of many transformations to our public safety system...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeColorado Village Collaborative

Safe Outdoor Spaces are one of many transformations to our public safety system that emerged in the wake of last summer‚Äôs protests launched by the murder of Geo...rge Floyd.

Structural racism in the forms of slavery, redlining, segregation, prison/policing all play a significant role in the fact that Black, Indigenous, and People of Color are more likely to experience unsheltered homelessness in America.

A recent report on street encampments released by the US Department of Housing and Urban Development made the following claim: ‚ÄúUnsheltered homelessness is the tragic result of the country‚Äôs affordable housing crisis that stems from a combination of increasing rates of deep poverty and a lack of deeply affordable housing. Due to the impacts of structural racism, the affordable housing crisis is especially dire for Blacks and Latinos who are overrepresented among the homeless population.‚Äù

Stand with us as we promote racial justice through housing justice.

See More
item.author: North Denver for Social Justice

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ DenverSURJ Denver is raising funds to pay our friends at Celestial...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

SURJ Denver is raising funds to pay our friends at Celestial Alegr√≠a to develop a curriculum for a 10-week program on confronting anti-Blackness in white commun...ities, to be offered Fall 2021.

During May and June, we will work to reach our fundraising goal of $7,000, 100% of which will go directly to Celestial Alegr√≠a's consultants as payment for developing this curriculum. Any additional funds raised will be used for scholarships to help defray costs for fall workshop attendees. Look for posts and other social media content as the fundraiser progresses!

Donate:
1. Through Denver SURJ‚Äôs fiscal sponsor El Centro Humantario: (please add a note ‚ÄúFor Denver SURJ Ed Fundraiser‚Äù -- this donation is tax deductible) via:
-Their Colorado Gives page: https://www.coloradogives.org/index.php‚Ä¶
-Their PayPal: http://paypal.me/CentroHumanitario

2. To @surjdenver on Venmo (please add a note ‚ÄúFor Denver SURJ Ed Fundraiser"). NOTE: any funds donated via Venmo will be transferred to El Centro monthly. While this method is easier, because it does not go through El Centro, it is not tax deductible, and you will not receive a donation letter or receipt from El Centro.

Also, if you don't already, please like and follow Celestial Alegr√≠a, contribute to their Reparations Network, and stay tuned for more info about the Fall 2021 program.

See More
